text.0: the praisesong let him sing forth bursting birdlike sing we that hymn which like heavens light expandeth.
text.1: that the milkgiving cows may unimpeded call to the sacred grass the gods assembly.
text.2: let the bull sing with bulls whose toil is worship with a loud roar like some wild beast that hungers.
text.3: praised god the glad priest brings his hearts devotion the holy youth presents twofold oblation.
text.4: may the priest come circling the measured stations and with him bring the earths autumnal fruitage.
text.5: let the horse neigh led near let the steer bellow let the voice go between both worlds as herald.
text.6: to him we offer welcomest oblations the pious bring their strengthinspiring praises.
text.7: may indra wondrous in his might accept them carborne and swift to move like the nāsatyas.
text.8: praise thou that indra who is truly mighty the carborne warrior maghavan the hero.
text.9: stronger in war than those who fight against him borne by strong steeds who kills enclosing darkness.
text.10: him who surpasses heroes in his greatness the earth and heavens suffice not for his girdles.
text.11: indra endues the earth to be his garment and godlike wears the heaven as twere a frontlet.
text.12: thee hero guardian of the brave in battles who roamest in the vanto draw thee hither.
text.13: indra the hosts agree beside the soma and joy for his great actions in the chieftain.
text.14: libations in the sea to thee are pleasant when thy divine floods come to cheer these people.
text.15: to thee the cow is sum of all things grateful when with the wish thou seekest men and princes.
text.16: so may we in this one be well befriended well aided as it were through praise of chieftains.
text.17: that indra still may linger at our worship as one led swift to work to hear our praises.
text.18: like men in rivalry extolling princes our friend be indra wielder of the thunder.
text.19: like true friends of some citys lord within them held in good rule with sacrifice they help him.
text.20: for every sacrifice makes indra stronger yea when he goes around angry in spirit.
text.21: as pleasure at the ford invites the thirsty as the long way brings him who gains his object.
text.22: let us not here contend with gods o indra for here o mighty one is thine own portion.
text.23: the great whose friends the bounteous maruts honour as with a stream his song who pours oblations.
text.24: addressed to thee is this our praise o indra lord of bay steeds find us hereby advancement.
text.25: so mayst thou lead us on o god to comfort may we find strengthening food in full abundance.
